text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly names the Intellectual Property Enterprise Court (IPEC) as the appropriate court for UK litigation in section 6.1, stating: \"PAP for Trade-Mark Infringement (UKIPO\u2019s \u201cIntellectual Property \u2013 Pre-Action Protocol\u201d - Part 2).\" While it doesn't explicitly name IPEC in the PAP section, it is implied by the context of UK IP litigation for SMEs, and more directly, the structure of UK IP litigation discussed points towards the specialist court.", "criterion_id": "39f1d135-9d7b-44e3-9251-603af0564847"}
